result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin M Leggett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Restitution Hearing 6/13/16 @ 1:15pm in 16CF650 file only

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 11:17am
INCLUDES 15CF685, 15CF650, 14CF76
State appears by ADA Theresa Wetzsteon for ADA Ralph Uttke. Deft appears in person, in custody, pro se; writ from Dodge. Defense Atty Andrew Morgan does NOT appear.
Date and time set for restitution hearing


State says court clerk has tried
State is requesting to reset for calender call and will draft order to court for remaining issues of restitution
State also is asking court for deft to appear by telephone from WSPS at next hearing
Deft is in agreement with resetting matter and would like to appear by telephone
COURT asks state to prepare letter for court and include Atty Morgan in letter
COURT allows deft to appear by telephone from Dodge County

CC: 05/16/16 at 1:00pm Br. 1 JA

Adj: 11:19am
Restitution hearing on May 9, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Plea and sentencing hearing on 3-11-2016.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 1:35pm
INCLUDES 14CF76, 15CF650, and 15CF685
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer; Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty Andrew Morgan. 
Date and time set for sentencing hearing

State says here for argued SAR in 14CF76 and argued sentencing in 15CF685 & 15CF650. VRCW.
Atty Morgan does not have objections to SAR packet
State makes recommendation on sentencing based on PSI report
Atty Morgan does not object to states sentencing guidelines based on PSI
State makes arguments as to sentencing recommendations
Atty Morgan makes argument as to sentencing

COURT ORDERS: 15CF685 Ct. 1 (Burglary-Building or dwelling, PTAC): 10 years WSPS- 5 years IC, 5 years ES. 15CF650 Ct. 2 (Felon Possess Firearm- repeater): 10 years WSPS- 5 years IC, 5 years ES. Ct. 3 (Resisting or obstructing an officer- repeater): 2 years WSPS- 1 year IC, 1 year ES. All 3 counts of sentencing to run concurrent to each other. Granted 234 days credit on all 3 counts. 14CF76 Ct. 1 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs): 3 and half years WSPS- 1 and half years IC, 2 years ES, concurrent to all other sentencing. Granted 377 days credit for time served. Deft is eligible for both prison programs- Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse. CONDITIONS OF ES: No contact with St. John's Baptist Church, M.M., K.R. and co-defendants: T.E. and D. P. Pay back $1000 deductible to St. John's Baptist Church at 25% prison wages with remaining balance on ES, joint and several. Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, subject to random testing to check for compliance. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of the two. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. Pay any other CC. 

State says will need to set separate restitution hearing at later date in 15CF650
COURT advises both parties to set restitution hearing in future with Br 1 JA

Deft is remanded to MC Sheriff's Dept to be transported to Dodge
Both parties to retain PSI reports in confidential manner

probation revocation packet w/ revocation packet
stj

Case Called: 8:44am. Clerk: Denise. INCLUDES 13CF304, 13CF861 - SAR'S; 14CM1997 - PLEA BR 2; 14CF76.  State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty James Kurszewski. State recites agreement to Plea and SAR. State indicates that Defendant is currently on felony probation in 14CF76 and recommends Restitution in that file. *VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to DRI ct 3 (theft/repeater) & ct 4 (OAR) 14CM1997- crt grants. PLEA: NO CONTEST - ct 1 (retail theft/repeater); ct 2 (obstructing/repeater) 14CM1997. Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Statements by State & Defense. Defendant makes statement. 
COURT ORDERS: 14CM1997- 9 months jail on each count, concurent to all other sentences; with huber pursuant to jail criteria - work, child care; treament; N/A; AA Meetings. 152 days credit.
COURT ORDERS: 13CF304 ct 2 & 13CF861 ct 5 - 9 months jail, concurrent to each other; with huber pursuant to jail criteria - work, child care; treament; N/A; AA Meetings.152 days credit. COURT orders outstanding costs pursuant to page 5 of SAR packet converted to Civil Judgment. COURT ORDERS: 14CF76- Restitution to be paid in the continuing probation as follows: $2,660.00 13CF70304 and $54.07 13CF861. State to provide Order for the Court. Adjourned: 9:00am.
